title: The Coherence Cage

panel_structure.description: Evan inside transparent cage made of labeled behavior bars: 'Always kind,' 'Never late,' 'Predictably rational.' Others outside hold 'How Evan Works' manuals with 100% confidence meters. His quantum self presses against bars. Keys scattered outside but reaching for them causes observer panic.

Split view: Public Evan as smooth hologram on rails following mapped paths, anxiety meters dropping as others approach. Private Evan as wild kaleidoscope dancing in shadows. Bridge labeled 'The price of being knowable.' Mirror asks: 'Is freedom worth isolation?'

transformation_notes: This scene reveals the shadow of coherence from Scene 126. While coherence organizes the self, it also creates a cage of others' expectations. The tragedy: we cage ourselves for connection.
dialogue_rhythm: From weary recognition through social insight to bittersweet acceptance
narrator_role: Compassionate witness to the tragedy of social coherence
